reviews.text: Hotel - this is a 2 star hotel so do not expect the Ritz, but it has a nice lobby and is spotlessly clean. Helpful polite staff.
reviews.title: Excellent for the price

reviews.text: Room: decent size with a wet room. Its not gorgeous but for the price it was great value for money. Plenty of towels and free fast WIFI. Very comfortable bed. Small balcony.
reviews.title: a bit expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: right beside the train and bus stations, which is why I booked it. But its only a 10 minute walk into the centre of town. If I were in Grenoble for a weekend I would not stay here but for one night and access to onward transport it was perfect.
reviews.title: Okay room -pricey for what you get...

reviews.text: Value: I paid 57 euros for a double room for single use. Great value.
reviews.title: Simple place to stay by the station.
Decent budget hotel
reviews.text: The hotel staff are very friendly. The hotel being just next to the main train station and walking distance from city centre and all the attractions is very helpful. The tram/bus stop is just next to the hotel too. The breakfast is average but feels expensive. Its a non-smoking hotel which is a good thing for non smokers. The single rooms are a little cramped. I once returned to my room with my window open after room service. Open window had made the room very cold in winter! They have old fashioned heaters which do not heat the room very well. The bathrooms dont have heater in them. The shower was fine but the shower curtain did not contain the water very well and the footrug in the bathroom got wet. I wish they had more modern plumbing. The toiletries provided were not of great quality. Hairdrier and steam iron were provided by reception upon request which were good. Overall, I would say its conveniently located but overpriced.
